column6: 1. Understands the basics of debugging and the tools used for it.

1. Aware about the Monitoring and observability of team's domain
2. Recognize technical debt
column12:
1. Proficient at using systematic debugging to diagnose all issues located to a single service
2. Helps tune and change the monitoring on their team accordingly.
3. Can do multi-application and multi-layer profiling alone and optimize almost all offenders.
4. Proactively identifies risks for production issues and works with stakeholders to resolve.
column15:
1. Proficient at using systematic debugging to diagnose all issues within the scope of their domain.
2. Suggesting stability and performance improvements.
column18:

2.  Driving changes to the team's services to achieve stability and performance improvements.

column3:
1. Accomplishes tasks within an acceptable time frame
2. Acts according to task prioritisation
column6:
1. Understands value of rightsizing tasks to enable continuous integration and incremental delivery.
2. Can estimate work tasks with help from teammates & manager
column7:
Sprint Velocity
Code Commits Frequency
Deployment Frequency
column9:
1. Before beginning work, ensures that tasks are appropriately sized.
2. Understands and acts according to task prioritisation. Notes dependencies.
3. Usually handles risk, change, and uncertainty within their personal scope of work effectively.
column12:
1. Reviews tasks critically and ensures they’re appropriately sized
2. Handles risk, change, and uncertainty within their personal scope of work effectively.
column15:
1. Maintains a strongly consistent personal velocity of work tasks.
2. Knows when to conclude conversations, meetings, and pre-work tasks in order to complete work on time.
3. Thoroughly vets work requirements and helps refine them to fulfill the intent of the requirements.
column18:
1. Reviews epics and projects critically and ensures they’re appropriately broken down and prioritised, and well understood by the team.
2. At task and epic level, works within their team to foster a culture of priority setting and urgency in alignment with organizational strategy.
column21:
1. Reviews cross-team work critically and ensures it’s appropriately broken down and prioritised, and well understood by all involved teams.
2. Effectively handles risk, change, and uncertainty across several teams

column3:
1. Adhere to Company's Culture, tools and compliance
2. Knows how to ask good questions of their teammates
column6:
1. Participates in team on-call 
2. Participates in follow-up retrospectives
3. Dives into new projects & technologies with curiosity and drive to understand
column9:
1. Escalates any blockers, delays, and cost ballooning to their team daily
2. Commits to a realistic amount of work,
column12:
1. Ensures their commitments are realistic, understands their priority and urgency, and delivers upon them accordingly
2. When taking action, weighs cost and value in order to take the most economic action
3. Understands, negotiates & applies work priorities correctly.
column15:
1. Anticipates and communicates blockers, delays, and cost ballooning for their work before they require escalation
2. Uses economic thinking in their own work, and to make suggestions to teammates.
column18:
1. Anticipates and communicates blockers, delays, and cost ballooning within their team’s projects, before they require escalation
2. Leverages own abilities and practices to mentor and improve the productivity of the entire team.
column21:
1.  Successfully manages cross-team commitments, their progress, and roadmap to delivery
2. Successfully manages cross-team commitments and work completion.

column3:
1. Understands how to deliver praise and constructive feedback in a useful manner.
2. Communicates effectively, clearly, concisely and in an audience-oriented way, in written and verbal form.
3. Pays attention to nonverbal communication.
column6:
1. Avoids surprising stakeholders whenever project expectations change; communicates changes early and often.
2. Consistently communicates with project stakeholders about expectations
4. Communicates accurately about all technical subjects in their work.
5. Fully embraces team solutions and commits to delivery without issue
column9: 1. Escalates any blockers, delays, and cost ballooning to their team daily
column12:
1. Can usually explain technical subjects to non-technical teammates.
2. Approaches disagreement with inquisitiveness, empathy and the goal of a stronger solution
3. Guides team toward a decision, clarifies and gets buy-in, and holds self & teammates accountable for decision.
4. Delivers feedback to their team's business stakeholders when opportunities arise. 
5.  Encourages their teammates to openly share their opinions and contribute to discussions
column15:
1. Communicates effectively, clearly, concisely in written and verbal form both technical and non technical subjects, and in an audience-oriented way.
2. Helps their teammates overcome obstacles, resolve blockers, and complete work tasks.
column18: 1. Proactively identifies risks for production issues and works with stakeholders to resolve.
column21:
1. Communicates about production issues effectively with public & leadership.
2. Fosters a culture within their team where people are encouraged to share their opinions and contribute to discussions in a respectful manner, approach disagreement non-defensively

column6:
1. Openly shares their opinions and contributes to discussions in a respectful manner
2. Understands their area of work and shares their knowledge frequently with their teammates.
column9:
1. Adds new and relevant documentation to existing repositories of knowledge.
2. Contributes to their team's documentation. Watches out for opportunities to share knowledge.
column12: 1. Understands their team's domain, shares their knowledge frequently with their teammates and contributes to their team's documentation
column15: 1. Often adds new and relevant documentation to existing repositories of knowledge.
column18: 1. Understands the organizational value of great documentation and spends time to maintain, update and extend existing repositories of knowledge.
column21: 1. Creates & structures documentation for large code projects concisely & consistently.

column12:
1.  Mentors teammates one-on-one with or without prompting.
2. Always treats mentored teammates with respect and kindness, regardless of their experience.

column18:

column21:

2. Seeks out mentoring opportunities specifically to create team redundancy and backfill ability. 
3. Mentors members of other teams as needed.

column18: 1. Articulates a coherent future vision for whole systems and several components for which they have responsibility.
column21:
1. Articulates a coherent future vision for many systems tended by their team.
2. Often assists teammates with building and articulating visions for their responsibility areas.

1. Takes ownership of decisions made in their team by helping their teammates make clear decisions in alignment with organizational goals, backing decisions made, and taking responsibility for their success.

1. Fosters a culture within their team of having conversations based on organizational strategy and principles to create alignment. Strongly oriented towards goals and ensures their team is continuously working towards their goals.
